intro: Trichinium drummondii var. majus, commonly known as the showy trichinium, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or arid environments. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to native plant gardens and ecological restorations.
